finding: The variant rs13050728 was shown to increase IFNAR2 expression specifically in classical monocytes during COVID-19 in symptomatic patients compared to healthy controls. This finding emphasizes the role of IFNAR2 in the immune response during SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The synonymous SNP, rs702859, in the KCNJ6 gene was positively linked to electroencephalographic frontal theta event-related oscillations (ERO) in subjects with alcohol use disorder (AUD). It was found to influence the magnitude and topography of ERO theta power during a monetary gambling task, reflecting a genetic connection to neuronal circuits.
title: Alcohol reverses the effects of KCNJ6 (GIRK2) noncoding variants on excitability of human glutamatergic neurons

finding: SNP rs702860, located within the KCNJ6 gene, was associated with the ERO endophenotype and alcohol use disorder (AUD). This noncoding SNP contributed to the genetic understanding of how ERO responses might relate to AUD.
title: Alcohol reverses the effects of KCNJ6 (GIRK2) noncoding variants on excitability of human glutamatergic neurons

finding: The noncoding SNP rs2835872, also within the KCNJ6 gene, was linked to the ERO endophenotype and AUD. Its association underscored the relevance of KCNJ6 SNPs in the context of genetic factors related to alcohol dependence.
title: Alcohol reverses the effects of KCNJ6 (GIRK2) noncoding variants on excitability of human glutamatergic neurons

finding: The rs2837990 variant was associated with a strong genotype × age interaction affecting 5mC levels at the BACE2 locus. Specifically, the decrease in 5mC levels with age was significant only for individuals carrying the G>A allele of this variant, with the effect size indicating a significant influence (β scale 95% CI: [0.11, 0.13], P_adj = 7.28×10^−10). BACE2 encodes a protease involved in amyloid beta peptide generation, integral to Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: The Immune Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The SNP rs12329760 was identified as a protective variant against severe COVID-19. It influenced the catalytic ability of the TMPRSS2 enzyme, which plays a crucial role in the viral entry of SARS-CoV-2.
title: Semantic and population analysis of the genetic targets related to COVID-19 and its association with genes and diseases

finding: The variant rs2834712 was associated with MPN risk and located within an intron of the RUNX1 gene, suggesting its role in regulating hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) function.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs2298515 was identified as having the lowest univariate p-value of 5.6 × 10^-7, indicating a significant association with the risk of radiation-associated contralateral breast cancer (RCBC). This finding suggested a robust connection between this SNP and the biological mechanisms influencing RCBC.
title: Machine Learning Methods to Identify Genetic Correlates of Radiation-Associated Contralateral Breast Cancer in the WECARE Study

finding: The rs2257167 CG/CC genotypes in <italic>IFNAR1</italic> were associated with a higher risk of developing Congenital Zika Syndrome (CZS) in newborns, with an odds ratio of 3.73. This association was significant following correction for multiple comparisons, indicating that these genotypes influenced the immune response and placental gene expression, which were critical factors in CZS outcomes.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with interferon alfa receptor 1

finding: The variant rs35074065 was significantly associated with TMPRSS2 expression (p=3.9×10^-11) and showed a high probability of direct causal effect (PPA=41.6%) on TMPRSS2 expression in human lung samples. It was linked to respiratory phenotypes including emphysema (p=5.64×10^-7) and asthma (p=6.7×10^-4). This variant was particularly noteworthy for disrupting binding sites of IRF and STAT transcription factors, suggesting roles in interferon signaling.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The variant rs7279188 showed nominal evidence of association with respiratory medication use including salmeterol plus fluticasone propionate (p=1.3×10^-5). It was among the group of common variants with predictive regulatory effects on AT2 cells.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: This variant was nominally associated with bacterial pneumonia (p=2.4×10^-4) and was included in the set of variants affecting respiratory health outcomes.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The variant rs9974995 was significantly associated with bronchiectasis (p=7.1×10^-4) and showed nominal association with TMPRSS2 expression in the lung.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: This variant was associated with bronchiectasis (p=8.1×10^-4) suggesting its possible impact on respiratory function.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The variant rs1557372 demonstrated nominal evidence for association with TMPRSS2 expression (p=2.9×10^-5) and respiratory health outcomes.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The study identified the missense variant rs200655253 located in the <italic>HSF2BP</italic> gene, which leads to the substitution of serine to leucine at position 167 (p.Ser167Leu). This variant was found to be homozygous in affected individuals with Premature Ovarian Insufficiency (POI) in a consanguineous family, while all fertile siblings and parents carried it in a heterozygous state. The variant was characterized as being very rare and predicted to be pathogenic by 11 out of 18 predictive tools, linking it directly to the observed phenotype of non-syndromic ovarian insufficiency.
title: A missense in HSF2BP causing Primary Ovarian Insufficiency affects meiotic recombination by its novel interactor C19ORF57/MIDAP

finding: SNP rs28678082 was associated with schizophrenia at a p-value of 3.4 x 10^-8 in the cluster analysis, marking it as a notable finding distinct from earlier univariate MRI GWAS results, where the lowest p-value was 4.8 x 10^-7. This indicates a relevant association worth further investigation in the context of psychiatric genetics.
title: Linking the genetic structure of neuroanatomical phenotypes with psychiatric disorders

finding: The rs13050728 variant on chromosome 21 was significantly associated with COVID-19 severity (P = 4.07e-21, T = risk allele). Its sQTL effect increased novel splicing isoforms of the transcripts in monocytes/macrophages, correlating with higher severity risk in patients harboring the risk T allele.
title: CiDRE+ M2c macrophages hijacked by SARS-CoV-2 cause COVID-19 severity

finding: At the MX2 locus, rs398206 was validated as a common causal variant for eQTL, meQTL, and melanoma risk. This finding reinforced the role of DNA methylation in mediating melanoma risk.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs183453668 was established as a significant association with recurrent miscarriage on chromosome 21, showing a MAF of 0.5% and a P-value of 2.8×10^-8. It was linked to gene candidates suggested by chromatin interaction data.
title: The genetic architecture of sporadic and recurrent miscarriage

finding: The allele associated with melanoma risk in rs398206 was characterized as having significant allelic transcriptional activity in the <italic>MX2</italic> gene located at chromosome band 21q22.3. The A allele was shown to enhance <italic>MX2</italic> expression in primary human melanocytes, correlating with a <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL effect. Functionally, it was found that the transcription factor YY1 preferentially bound to the A allele, which subsequently elevated <italic>MX2</italic> levels. This association was validated through various experimental methods, including MPRA and luciferase assays.
title: Massively parallel reporter assays combined with cell-type specific eQTL informed multiple melanoma loci and identified a pleiotropic function of HIV-1 restriction gene, MX2, in melanoma promotion

finding: The SNP rs13050922 was identified as a positive and original finding related to the estimation of global nighttime lights, which serve as a proxy for human activities and urbanization. This was critical for understanding the implications of artificialization on biodiversity and the assessment of priority conservation areas.
title: Integrating biodiversity assessments into local conservation planning: the importance of assessing suitable data sources

finding: SNP rs13615, located within the 3' untranslated region of ADAMTS1, was identified as having the highest probability of causality (0.630) for pre-FEV1 metrics. It was linked to admixture mapping on chromosome 21, suggesting ADAMTS1 may be a functional genetic driver in lung function, particularly for subjects of African ancestry where its minor allele frequency was markedly lower.
title: Integrative genomic analysis in African American children with asthma finds 3 novel loci associated with lung function

finding: The SNP rs2249666 was found to be a PBS-specific sQTL colocalizing with the Total Joint Replacement (TJR) GWAS signal, suggesting a direct connection to OA.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs9981884 served as an index variant for a TJR GWAS signal, highlighting its relevance to the colocalization with altered splicing events.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs13051037 was identified as significantly associated with enhanced anti-tumor immunity in renal cell carcinoma tumors that exhibited 14q deletions. This finding was supported by validation through previously published single-cell RNA sequencing data, indicating its relevance to immune phenotypes in the context of tumor genomic alterations.
title: RIGATonI: An R software for Rapid Identification of Genomic Alterations in Tumors affecting lymphocyte Infiltration

finding: The V415I SNP (rs148125094) was identified as the most frequently sampled SNP in TMPRSS2, with an allele frequency of 1.1x10^-3. This SNP led to reduced binding to the HKU1 isolate N1 receptor binding domain (RBD) compared to the wildtype human TMPRSS2. This finding was relevant to understanding receptor engagement and the potential modulation of susceptibility to HKU1 infection.
title: Human coronavirus HKU1 recognition of the TMPRSS2 host receptor

finding: The S463F SNP (rs2146419758) was characterized as having an extremely low allele frequency of 2.1x10^-6 and it almost entirely abrogated binding to the wildtype HKU1 RBD. This was significant because the mutation was linked to steric incompatibility with the binding interface as noted in the cryoEM structural analysis, suggesting a potential reduction in susceptibility to HKU1 infection.
title: Human coronavirus HKU1 recognition of the TMPRSS2 host receptor

finding: Identified as exhibiting better MAF values, it was found significant in forensic genetic applications.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs1736137 was linked to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). It exhibited highly significant expression-modulating activity in both resting and stimulated CD4 T cells, with the IBD-risk allele consistently increasing transcription.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs59515793 was associated with pallidum volume variance, revealing significant evidence with a p-value of 2.4×10^-11. The variance explained by this SNP under the variance model was 0.405%. This finding suggested a genetic basis for variability in pallidum volume among individuals.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: This specific locus matched with rs59515793, emphasizing its role in pallidum volume variance. Its original identification reflected a strong genetic influence on this phenotype.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The SNP rs13051118 was associated with the mTOR pathway's role in chemoresistance and chemosensitivity. It related to a study where genetic mechanisms influencing tumor cell survival under chemotherapeutic treatments were investigated. Findings indicated that pharmacological suppression led to a reversible resistant phenotype in various tissue-origin cancer cells.
title: mTOR is a Major Determinant of Chemosensitivity

finding: The rs35074065 variant was identified as a delC variant of the TMPRSS2 gene, which interacted with the D614G mutation of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. This variant was reported to confer a functional advantage in populations where D614G was prevalent, particularly in Europe, America, and South Asia, suggesting a potential role in the spread of the D614G variant. The evidence regarding its effects on disease severity and mortality remained unclear, as multiple other factors like age and comorbidity played significant roles.
title: Molecular characterization of SARS-CoV-2 from Bangladesh: Implications in genetic diversity, possible origin of the virus, and functional significance of the mutations

finding: The rs12329760 was found to be a functional missense mutation that caused a change in the amino acid sequence from valine to methionine at position 197. This variant was positively associated with TMPRSS2-ERG fusion and with increased risk for prostate cancer, with frequencies ranging from 10% to 63% across North Eurasian populations, indicating its significant prevalence and potential clinical relevance.
title: Structural variability, expression profile and pharmacogenetics properties of TMPRSS2 gene as a potential target for COVID-19 therapy

finding: This SNP showed an association with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) through the CpG site cg19297788, suggesting its genetic influence on IBD risk via methylation changes.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The p.S38G variant was identified as more common globally, with an allele frequency of 65.8% across all ancestral populations in gnomAD, ranging from 57.4%-71.3%. This variant was used in functional studies of KCNE1.
title: High-throughput functional mapping of variants in an arrhythmia gene, KCNE1, reveals novel biology

finding: The SNP rs2248244 was identified as a PD risk variant through a locus zoom plot generated using conditional analysis statistics. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors associated with Parkinson's Disease.
title: The IPDGC/GP2 Hackathon - an open science event for training in data science, genomics, and collaboration using Parkinson’s disease data

finding: The study demonstrated a significant positive association between the rs2070788 SNP (G Allele) and the case fatality rate (CFR) in the Indian population. It was found that the GG genotype of the rs2070788 allele exhibited higher expression levels of TMPRSS2 in lung tissue compared to the AG and AA genotypes, indicating a potential role in determining differential COVID-19 disease vulnerability.
title: Genetic association of TMPRSS2 rs2070788 polymorphism with COVID-19 Case Fatality Rate among Indian populations

finding: The KCNJ15 rs3746876 polymorphism was replicated in studies suggesting its connection to type 2 diabetes, augmenting risk factors for kidney disease.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was found to be associated in trans with LINC00936 in CD14+ monocytes, suggesting implications in the regulation of the mTOR pathway.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: Similar to rs34217534, rs2826196 was associated with LINC00936 in CD14+ monocytes, highlighting its role in immune cell regulation.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs2070424 in the SOD1 gene was found to be associated with an increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD). This association was highlighted in a study conducted by Spisak et al., which contributed to understanding the genetic factors involved in AD pathology.
title: A Meta-Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Brain Transcriptomic Data

finding: The SNP rs449998, an intronic variant in the DSCAM gene on chromosome 21, was associated with changes in nucleus accumbens volume. DSCAM is important in the development of both the central and peripheral nervous systems and is also implicated in congenital heart disease.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The SNP rs13051171 was originally identified in relation to pancreatic cancers responsive to vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV)-based oncolytic virotherapy. The research indicated that variations in this SNP could influence the efficacy of treatment to combat cancer, suggesting its role as a potential biomarker for identifying responsive cases in patients.
title: Bacterial Effector Screening Reveals RNF214 as a Virus Restriction Factor in Mammals

finding: The SNP N109S (rs1402769820) involved a mutation from Asparagine to Serine at position 109, resulting in structural changes that were predicted to be damaging to the RUNX1 protein.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The SNP N109S (rs767874011) involved a mutation from Asparagine to Histidine at position 109, which was found to affect the protein structure adversely, signifying potential loss-of-function due to this change.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The SNP L144P (rs979009101) indicated a substitution of Leucine with Proline at position 144, which was categorized as damaging to the RUNX1 protein's functional integrity.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The SNP V155A (rs750866158) involved the mutation from Valine to Alanine at position 155. This change was noted for its harmful structural impact on the RUNX1 protein.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The SNP G165S (rs993436723) indicated the substitution of Glycine with Serine at position 165, which was recognized as damaging to the structure and function of the RUNX1 protein.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The SNP Y285C (rs1191218095) demonstrated a mutation that changed Tyrosine to Cysteine at position 285 and was able to disrupt protein function adversely. Additionally, the same SNP also showed another effect changing Histidine to Proline at position 459.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The KCNJ15 rs3746876 SNP was associated with susceptibility to type 2 diabetes in a Japanese population, further identifying its role in diabetes genetics.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13051118 was associated with the resistance mechanisms identified in the study of De Conti et al. (2021), where the authors discussed the role of drug-tolerant persister cells in cancer, particularly in response to therapies targeting the MAPK pathway. The findings highlighted that overexpression of KRAS and NRAS, linked to the presence of this SNP, contributed to the drug tolerance observed in lung, breast, and melanoma cancer cells.
title: Processing body dynamics drive non-genetic MEK inhibitors tolerance by fine-tuning KRAS and NRAS translation

finding: The cis-eQTL (rs1893592) was identified in resting T cells and colocalised with GWAS hits for celiac disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and primary sclerosing cholangitis, emphasizing its relevance in autoimmune disease susceptibility.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The OLIG2 gene SNP rs1059004 showed association with negative traits related to susceptibility to depression.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs469390, located within the MX1 gene, was found to be associated with HIV total DNA in the European ancestry male subpopulation. Although the association was positive, indicating a higher HIV reservoir size with higher expression of MX1, eQTL analyses suggested that positive SNP effects corresponded with increased MX1 gene expression, reinforcing the significance of this relationship.
title: Host Variation in Interferon, MHC Class I, Glycosylation, and Viral Transcription Genes Predict HIV Persistence
